pull.title: guix: remove `util-linux`
pull.body:
`hexdump` was used for the tests, until CMake. This package is no-longer needed to complete a Guix build (or needed in the CI). `util-linux` has been in the manifest since Guix was first introduced (3e80ec3ea9691c7c89173de922a113e643fe976b).


events.message: ci: remove util-linux from centos CI

events.body:

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30997](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30997) (build: Switch to Qt 6 by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Concept ACK

Does this make a difference to the build env?
i wonder if util-linux is somehow coming in through the closure of one of the other packages, it seems such a base thing

> Does this make a difference to the build env?

Yea, it's pruning out`util-linux`. See here for a diff of `/bin` of the profile of master vs this PR: https://gist.github.com/fanquake/2785035aeab228a1d6046dbbdd55f299, for `x86_64-linux-gnu`.

Nice!

Of those, `hexdump` was required with the autotools build system. Not sure about others.

> Of those, hexdump was required

Thanks, that is what I'd been looking for, but missed in the list ðŸ˜….

Post-merge ACK 4d668549825cc2f999b349e8fcd8cc9434c409c3.
